english_translation: Chapter: Secret Charity

Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with them): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Verily, secret charity extinguishes the wrath of the Lord Most High, and verily charity extinguishes the sin just as water extinguishes fire. So when one of you gives charity with his right hand, let him conceal it from his left hand, for it will fall into the right hand of the Lord, blessed and exalted be He, and both hands of my Lord, glory be to Him and exalted be He, are right hands. He will nurture it just as one of you nurtures his young camel or young animal, until the morsel becomes like Uhud (mountain).'

english_translation: Chapter: The Virtue of Lending

Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with them): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever extends a loan, it is like charity for him.' Then when it was the next day, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Whoever extends a loan, it is like two charities for him each day.' He said to him the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: 'I said: O Messenger of Allah, yesterday you said: Whoever extends a loan, it is like charity for him, and today you said: Whoever extends a loan, it is like two charities for him each day.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Yes, whoever extends a loan and delays its repayment after its due date, it is like two charities for him each day.'

english_translation: Chapter: The virtue of Fasting

Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with them): When the first night of Ramadan came, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ stood and praised Allah and extolled His praises, then said: 'O people, indeed Allah has sufficed you from your enemies among the jinn, and has promised you the response, and said 'Call upon Me, I will respond to you.' Know that Allah has assigned seven angels to every rebellious Satan so he is not free until the month of Ramadan ends, and the gates of the heaven are opened from the first night of it to the last night for the time of supplication in it being accepted.' Then when the first night of the last ten came, he rolled up his sleeves and fastened his lower garment and exited from his house and stayed in seclusion for the last ten nights, spending the nights in worship. He would bathe between the two evening prayers, may the blessings of Allah and peace be upon him. He said: I asked the Imam Abu al-Husayn Zayd ibn Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: What is the meaning of 'fastened his lower garment'? He said: He would separate from women during them.

english_translation: Chapter: The virtue of Suhur (pre-dawn meal)

Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with them): The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Indeed, Allah and His angels send blessings upon those who seek forgiveness at dawn and those who take the pre-dawn meal. So let one of you take the pre-dawn meal, even if only with a sip of water. For indeed in that is a blessing. The man who takes the pre-dawn meal from that blessing remains satisfied and quenched throughout his day, and it is the distinction between your fasting and the fasting of the Christians - the eating of the pre-dawn meal.'

english_translation: Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with them): If a fasting person is overcome by vomiting, his fasting is not nullified. But if he intentionally drinks, he breaks his fast and must make up the day. Three things do not break the fast of a fasting person: involuntary vomiting, wet dreams, and kissing. I dislike kissing for the young but allow it for the elderly. Cupping and kohl do not break the fast, but I dislike cupping fearing weakness. The fasting person should not use a wet miswak and should not wet his miswak, using it between now and midday. I asked about a fly entering the throat of a fasting person, and it was said it does not break the fast. Regarding rinsing the mouth where water enters the throat: if within three times it does not break the fast, but if after three times it does break the fast. Nasal drops and enemas break the fasting. Regarding the traveler breaking the fast during travel: the traveler breaks the fast during a journey of three days or more. If he intends to stay ten days he must fast.

english_translation: Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with them): The woman experiencing abnormal uterine bleeding must make up the fasts but does not need to make up the prayers. The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came out with water dripping from his head and led us in the Fajr prayer during Ramadan, and it was the night of Umm Salamah. I went to her and asked her about it, and she said: 'Yes, if that was from intercourse without nocturnal emission, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ completed his fast that day and did not make it up.' A child who reaches puberty during Ramadan and a disbeliever who converts during Ramadan must make up that day and the rest of the month, and they have no obligation regarding what has passed.

english_translation: Chapter: Those to whom exemption is permitted to break the fast in Ramadan

Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with them): When Allah the Mighty and Majestic ordained the obligation of Ramadan fasting, a pregnant woman came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I am pregnant and I fear for what is in my womb if I fast.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to her: 'Go and break your fast. When you are able, fast.' A nursing woman came to him and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, this is the month of Ramadan ordained, and I fear that if I fast my milk will stop and my child will perish.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to her: 'Go and break your fast. When you are able, fast.' A man suffering from thirst came and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, this is the month of Ramadan ordained and I cannot endure without water for an hour and I fear for myself if I fast.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Go and break your fast. When you are able, fast.' An elderly man leaning on two people came and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, this is the month of Ramadan ordained and I cannot bear fasting.' The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: 'Go and feed poor people half a measure for each day.'

english_translation: Chapter: Making up the fasts of Ramadan

Narrated by Ali (may Allah be pleased with them): Regarding the sick and the traveler who break the fast in Ramadan, then make it up. They should follow consecutive days, but if they separate the days it is still acceptable. Regarding a sick person who dies owing days of Ramadan: he is paid for by feeding the poor half a measure for each day, and one does not fast on his behalf.
